name: account_add
description:
Add a previously created account from a seed, private key or public key (read-only).
Specify --single_key for single address or vanity address accounts.

arguments.name: account_name
arguments.description: name of the account to add

arguments.name: seed
arguments.description: seed to generate new account from

arguments.name: private_key
arguments.description: private key for new account

arguments.name: public_key
arguments.description: public key for new account

arguments.name: single_key
arguments.description: create single key account, default is multi-key

returns:
{
                "id": "account_id",
                "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                "name": "optional account name",
                "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                "private_key": "extended private key",
                "public_key": "extended public key",
                "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
            }

examples.title: Add an account from seed.
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "account_add", "params": {"account_name": "new account", "seed": "genuine case gate always artwork taxi garden hurdle shed detect proud east", "single_key": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.lbrynet: lbrynet account add "new account" --seed="genuine case gate always artwork taxi garden hurdle shed detect proud east"
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "account_add", "params": {"account_name": "new account", "seed": "genuine case gate always artwork taxi garden hurdle shed detect proud east", "single_key": false}}).json()

name: account_balance
description: Return the balance of an account

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: If provided only the balance for this account will be given. Otherwise default account.

arguments.name: confirmations
arguments.description: Only include transactions with this many confirmed blocks.

returns: (decimal) amount of lbry credits in wallet

name: account_create
description:
Create a new account. Specify --single_key if you want to use
the same address for all transactions (not recommended).

arguments.name: account_name
arguments.description: name of the account to create

arguments.name: single_key
arguments.description: create single key account, default is multi-key

returns:
{
                "id": "account_id",
                "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                "name": "optional account name",
                "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                "private_key": "extended private key",
                "public_key": "extended public key",
                "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
            }

examples.title: Create an account.

name: account_decrypt
description: Decrypt an encrypted account, this will remove the wallet password. The account must be unlocked to decrypt it

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id for the account to decrypt

returns: (bool) true if wallet is decrypted, otherwise false

name: account_encrypt
description: Encrypt an unencrypted account with a password

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id for the account to encrypt

returns: (bool) true if wallet is decrypted, otherwise false

name: account_fund
description:
Transfer some amount (or --everything) to an account from another
account (can be the same account). Amounts are interpreted as LBC.
You can also spread the transfer across a number of --outputs (cannot
be used together with --everything).

arguments.name: to_account
arguments.description: send to this account

arguments.name: from_account
arguments.description: spend from this account

arguments.name: amount
arguments.description: the amount to transfer lbc

arguments.name: everything
arguments.description: transfer everything (excluding claims), default: false.

arguments.name: outputs
arguments.description: split payment across many outputs, default: 1.

arguments.name: broadcast
arguments.description: actually broadcast the transaction, default: false.

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

name: account_list
description: List details of all of the accounts or a specific account.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: If provided only the balance for this account will be given

arguments.name: confirmations
arguments.description: required confirmations (default: 0)

arguments.name: include_claims
arguments.description: include claims, requires than a LBC account is specified (default: false)

arguments.name: show_seed
arguments.description: show the seed for the account

returns:
[
                {
                    "id": "account_id",
                    "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                    "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                    "name": "optional account name",
                    "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                    "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                    "private_key": "extended private key",
                    "public_key": "extended public key",
                    "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                    "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
                }
            ]

name: account_lock
description: Lock an unlocked account

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id for the account to lock

returns: (bool) true if account is locked, otherwise false

name: account_max_address_gap
description:
Finds ranges of consecutive addresses that are unused and returns the length
of the longest such range: for change and receiving address chains. This is
useful to figure out ideal values to set for 'receiving_gap' and 'change_gap'
account settings.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account for which to get max gaps

returns: (map) maximum gap for change and receiving addresses

name: account_remove
description: Remove an existing account.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to remove

returns:
{
                "id": "account_id",
                "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                "name": "optional account name",
                "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                "private_key": "extended private key",
                "public_key": "extended public key",
                "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
            }

examples.title: Remove an account.

name: account_send
description: Send the same number of credits to multiple addresses.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to fund the transaction

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

name: account_set
description: Change various settings on an account.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to change

arguments.name: default
arguments.description: make this account the default

arguments.name: new_name
arguments.description: new name for the account

arguments.name: receiving_gap
arguments.description: set the gap for receiving addresses

arguments.name: receiving_max_uses
arguments.description: set the maximum number of times to use a receiving address

arguments.name: change_gap
arguments.description: set the gap for change addresses

arguments.name: change_max_uses
arguments.description: set the maximum number of times to use a change address

returns:
{
                "id": "account_id",
                "is_default": "this account is used by default",
                "ledger": "name of crypto currency and network",
                "name": "optional account name",
                "seed": "human friendly words from which account can be recreated",
                "encrypted": "if account is encrypted",
                "private_key": "extended private key",
                "public_key": "extended public key",
                "address_generator": "settings for generating addresses",
                "modified_on": "date of last modification to account settings"
            }

examples.title: Modify maximum number of times a change address can be reused.

name: account_unlock
description: Unlock an encrypted account

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id for the account to unlock

returns: (bool) true if account is unlocked, otherwise false

name: address_is_mine
description: Checks if an address is associated with the current wallet.

arguments.name: address
arguments.description: address to check

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to use

returns: (bool) true, if address is associated with current wallet

description: List account addresses

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to use

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

description:
Return an address containing no balance, will create
a new address if there is none.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to use

returns: "an address in base58"

name: blob_announce
description: Announce blobs to the DHT

arguments.name: blob_hash
arguments.description: announce a blob, specified by blob_hash

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: announce all blobs associated with stream_hash

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: announce all blobs associated with sd_hash and the sd_hash itself

returns: (bool) true if successful

name: blob_delete
description: Delete a blob

arguments.name: blob_hash
arguments.description: blob hash of the blob to delete

returns: (str) Success/fail message

description: Download and return a blob

arguments.name: blob_hash
arguments.description: blob hash of the blob to get

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: timeout in number of seconds

returns: (str) Success/Fail message or (dict) decoded data

name: blob_list
description: Returns blob hashes. If not given filters, returns all blobs known by the blob manager

arguments.name: needed
arguments.description: only return needed blobs

arguments.name: finished
arguments.description: only return finished blobs

arguments.name: uri
arguments.description: filter blobs by stream in a uri

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: filter blobs by stream hash

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: filter blobs by sd hash

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: results page size

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page of results to return

returns: (list) List of blob hashes

name: blob_reflect
description: Reflects specified blobs

arguments.name: reflector_server
arguments.description: reflector address

returns: (list) reflected blob hashes

name: blob_reflect_all
description: Reflects all saved blobs
returns: (bool) true if successful

description: Get contents of a block

arguments.description: hash of the block to look up

arguments.name: height
arguments.description: height of the block to look up

returns: (dict) Requested block

{

                "inputs": [
                    {

                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",

name: channel_create
description: Create a new channel by generating a channel private key and establishing an '@' prefixed claim.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the channel prefixed with '@'

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new channel even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: content tags

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations of the channel, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: contact_email
arguments.description: email of channel owner

arguments.name: homepage_url
arguments.description: homepage url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: cover_url
arguments.description: url of cover image

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to store channel

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the channel is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

name: channel_export
description: Export serialized channel signing information for a given certificate claim id

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: Claim ID to export information about

returns: (str) Serialized certificate information

name: channel_import
description: Import serialized channel signing information (to allow signing new claims to the channel)

arguments.name: serialized_certificate_info
arguments.description: certificate info

returns: (dict) Result dictionary

name: channel_list
description: List my channel claims.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to use

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

name: channel_update
description: Update an existing channel claim.

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: claim_id of the channel to update

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: clear_tags
arguments.description: clear existing tags (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: clear_languages
arguments.description: clear existing languages (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: clear_locations
arguments.description: clear existing locations (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations of the channel, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: contact_email
arguments.description: email of channel owner

arguments.name: homepage_url
arguments.description: homepage url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: cover_url
arguments.description: url of cover image

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to store channel

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the channel is sent

arguments.name: new_signing_key
arguments.description: generate a new signing key, will invalidate all previous publishes

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

examples.title: Update a channel claim.
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "channel_update", "params": {"claim_id": "4a16eea8f2d6bfbd5d4d6740f3bf1b117d6924ca", "title": "New Channel", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "new_signing_key": false, "preview": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "channel_update", "params": {"claim_id": "4a16eea8f2d6bfbd5d4d6740f3bf1b117d6924ca", "title": "New Channel", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "new_signing_key": false, "preview": false}}).json()

name: claim_search
description:
Search for stream and channel claims on the blockchain.

Use --channel_id=<channel_id> to list all stream claims in a channel.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: find claims with this name

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: find a claim with this claim_id

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: find a claim with this txid:nout

arguments.name: nout
arguments.description: find a claim with this txid:nout

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: limit search to specific channel claim id (returns stream claims)

arguments.name: winning
arguments.description: limit to winning claims

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

name: file_delete
description: Delete a LBRY file

arguments.name: delete_from_download_dir
arguments.description: delete file from download directory, instead of just deleting blobs

arguments.name: delete_all
arguments.description: if there are multiple matching files, allow the deletion of multiple files. Otherwise do not delete anything.

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: delete by file sd hash

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: delete by file name in downloads folder

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: delete by file stream hash

arguments.name: rowid
arguments.description: delete by file row id

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: delete by file claim id

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: delete by file claim txid

arguments.name: nout
arguments.description: delete by file claim nout

arguments.name: claim_name
arguments.description: delete by file claim name

arguments.name: channel_claim_id
arguments.description: delete by file channel claim id

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: delete by file channel claim name

returns: (bool) true if deletion was successful

name: file_list
description: List files limited by optional filters

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: get file with matching sd hash

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: get file with matching file name in the downloads folder

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: get file with matching stream hash

arguments.name: rowid
arguments.description: get file with matching row id

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: get file with matching claim id

arguments.name: outpoint
arguments.description: get file with matching claim outpoint

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: get file with matching claim txid

arguments.name: nout
arguments.description: get file with matching claim nout

arguments.name: channel_claim_id
arguments.description: get file with matching channel claim id

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: get file with matching channel name

arguments.name: claim_name
arguments.description: get file with matching claim name

arguments.name: blobs_in_stream<blobs_in_stream>
arguments.description: get file with matching blobs in stream

arguments.name: blobs_remaining
arguments.description: amount of remaining blobs to download

arguments.name: sort
arguments.description: field to sort by (one of the above filter fields)

arguments.name: comparison
arguments.description: logical comparision, (eq | ne | g | ge | l | le)

returns:
[
                {
                    "completed": "(bool) true if download is completed",
                    "file_name": "(str) name of file",
                    "download_directory": "(str) download directory",
                    "points_paid": "(float) credit paid to download file",
                    "stopped": "(bool) true if download is stopped",
                    "stream_hash": "(str) stream hash of file",
                    "stream_name": "(str) stream name",
                    "suggested_file_name": "(str) suggested file name",
                    "sd_hash": "(str) sd hash of file",
                    "download_path": "(str) download path of file",
                    "mime_type": "(str) mime type of file",
                    "key": "(str) key attached to file",
                    "total_bytes_lower_bound": "(int) lower bound file size in bytes",
                    "total_bytes": "(int) file upper bound size in bytes",
                    "written_bytes": "(int) written size in bytes",
                    "blobs_completed": "(int) number of fully downloaded blobs",
                    "blobs_in_stream": "(int) total blobs on stream",
                    "blobs_remaining": "(int) total blobs remaining to download",
                    "status": "(str) downloader status",
                    "claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim id",
                    "txid": "(str) None if claim is not found else the transaction id",
                    "nout": "(int) None if claim is not found else the transaction output index",
                    "outpoint": "(str) None if claim is not found else the tx and output",
                    "metadata": "(dict) None if claim is not found else the claim metadata",
                    "channel_claim_id": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                    "channel_name": "(str) None if claim is not found or not signed",
                    "claim_name": "(str) None if claim is not found else the claim name"
                }
            ]

name: file_reflect
description: Reflect all the blobs in a file matching the filter criteria

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: get file with matching sd hash

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: get file with matching file name in the downloads folder

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: get file with matching stream hash

arguments.name: rowid
arguments.description: get file with matching row id

arguments.name: reflector
arguments.description: reflector server, ip address or url by default choose a server from the config

returns: (list) list of blobs reflected

name: file_set_status
description: Start or stop downloading a file

arguments.name: status
arguments.description: one of "start" or "stop"

arguments.name: sd_hash
arguments.description: set status of file with matching sd hash

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: set status of file with matching file name in the downloads folder

arguments.name: stream_hash
arguments.description: set status of file with matching stream hash

arguments.name: rowid
arguments.description: set status of file with matching row id

returns: (str) Confirmation message

name: get
description: Download stream from a LBRY name.

arguments.name: uri
arguments.description: uri of the content to download

arguments.name: file_name
arguments.description: specified name for the downloaded file

arguments.name: timeout
arguments.description: download timeout in number of seconds

returns:
(dict) Dictionary containing information about the stream
    {
        'completed': (bool) true if download is completed,
        'file_name': (str) name of file,
        'download_directory': (str) download directory,
        'points_paid': (float) credit paid to download file,
        'stopped': (bool) true if download is stopped,
        'stream_hash': (str) stream hash of file,
        'stream_name': (str) stream name ,
        'suggested_file_name': (str) suggested file name,
        'sd_hash': (str) sd hash of file,
        'download_path': (str) download path of file,
        'mime_type': (str) mime type of file,
        'key': (str) key attached to file,
        'total_bytes': (int) file size in bytes,
        'written_bytes': (int) written size in bytes,
        'blobs_completed': (int) number of fully downloaded blobs,
        'blobs_in_stream': (int) total blobs on stream,
        'status': (str) downloader status,
        'claim_id': (str) claim id,
        'outpoint': (str) claim outpoint string,
        'txid': (str) claim txid,
        'nout': (int) claim nout,
        'metadata': (dict) claim metadata,
        'channel_claim_id': (str) None if claim is not signed
        'channel_name': (str) None if claim is not signed
        'claim_name': (str) claim name
    }

name: peer_list
description: Get peers for blob hash

arguments.name: blob_hash
arguments.description: find available peers for this blob hash

arguments.name: search_bottom_out_limit
arguments.description: the number of search probes in a row that don't find any new peers before giving up and returning

returns:
(list) List of contact dictionaries {'address': <peer ip>, 'udp_port': <dht port>, 'tcp_port': <peer port>,
     'node_id': <peer node id>}

name: peer_ping
description:
Send a kademlia ping to the specified peer. If address and port are provided the peer is directly pinged,
if not provided the peer is located first.
returns: (str) pong, or {'error': <error message>} if an error is encountered

name: publish
description: Create or update a stream claim at a given name (use 'stream create/update' for more control).

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the content (can only consist of a-z A-Z 0-9 and -(dash))

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: file_path
arguments.description: path to file to be associated with name.

arguments.name: stream_type
arguments.description: type of stream

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee

arguments.name: fee_address
arguments.description: address where to send fee payments, will use value from --claim_address if not provided

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: author
arguments.description: author of the publication. The usage for this field is not the same as for channels. The author field is used to credit an author who is not the publisher and is not represented by the channel. For example, a pdf file of 'The Odyssey' has an author of 'Homer' but may by published to a channel such as '@classics', or to no channel at all

arguments.name: clear_tags
arguments.description: clear existing tags (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: clear_languages
arguments.description: clear existing languages (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: clear_locations
arguments.description: clear existing locations (prior to adding new ones)

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations relevant to the stream, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

arguments.name: license
arguments.description: publication license

arguments.name: license_url
arguments.description: publication license url

arguments.name: thumbnail_url
arguments.description: thumbnail url

arguments.name: release_time
arguments.description: original public release of content, seconds since UNIX epoch

arguments.name: duration
arguments.description: audio/video duration in seconds, an attempt will be made to calculate this automatically if not provided

arguments.name: image_width
arguments.description: image width

arguments.name: image_height
arguments.description: image height

arguments.name: video_width
arguments.description: video width

arguments.name: video_height
arguments.description: video height

arguments.name: video_duration
arguments.description: video duration in seconds, an attempt will be made to calculate this automatically if not provided

arguments.name: audio_duration
arguments.description: audio duration in seconds, an attempt will be made to calculate this automatically if not provided

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: claim id of the publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_name
arguments.description: name of publisher channel

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: one or more account ids for accounts to look in for channel certificates, defaults to all accounts.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: account to use for funding the transaction

arguments.name: claim_address
arguments.description: address where the claim is sent to, if not specified it will be determined automatically from the account

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

examples.title: Publish a file.
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "publish", "params": {"name": "a-new-stream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmpqaqmfma7", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "channel_account_id": [], "preview": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "publish", "params": {"name": "a-new-stream", "bid": "1.0", "file_path": "/tmp/tmpqaqmfma7", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "channel_account_id": [], "preview": false}}).json()

name: resolve
description: Get the claim that a URL refers to.

arguments.name: urls
arguments.description: one or more urls to resolve

returns:
Dictionary of results, keyed by url
    '<url>': {
            If a resolution error occurs:
            'error': Error message

            If the url resolves to a channel or a claim in a channel:
            'certificate': {
                'address': (str) claim address,
                'amount': (float) claim amount,
                'effective_amount': (float) claim amount including supports,
                'claim_id': (str) claim id,
                'claim_sequence': (int) claim sequence number (or -1 if unknown),
                'decoded_claim': (bool) whether or not the claim value was decoded,
                'height': (int) claim height,
                'depth': (int) claim depth,
                'has_signature': (bool) included if decoded_claim
                'name': (str) claim name,
                'permanent_url': (str) permanent url of the certificate claim,
                'supports: (list) list of supports [{'txid': (str) txid,
                                                     'nout': (int) nout,
                                                     'amount': (float) amount}],
                'txid': (str) claim txid,
                'nout': (str) claim nout,
                'signature_is_valid': (bool), included if has_signature,
                'value': ClaimDict if decoded, otherwise hex string
            }

            If the url resolves to a channel:
            'claims_in_channel': (int) number of claims in the channel,

            If the url resolves to a claim:
            'claim': {
                'address': (str) claim address,
                'amount': (float) claim amount,
                'effective_amount': (float) claim amount including supports,
                'claim_id': (str) claim id,
                'claim_sequence': (int) claim sequence number (or -1 if unknown),
                'decoded_claim': (bool) whether or not the claim value was decoded,
                'height': (int) claim height,
                'depth': (int) claim depth,
                'has_signature': (bool) included if decoded_claim
                'name': (str) claim name,
                'permanent_url': (str) permanent url of the claim,
                'channel_name': (str) channel name if claim is in a channel
                'supports: (list) list of supports [{'txid': (str) txid,
                                                     'nout': (int) nout,
                                                     'amount': (float) amount}]
                'txid': (str) claim txid,
                'nout': (str) claim nout,
                'signature_is_valid': (bool), included if has_signature,
                'value': ClaimDict if decoded, otherwise hex string
            }
    }

name: routing_table_get
description: Get DHT routing information

name: settings_get
description: Get daemon settings
returns:
(dict) Dictionary of daemon settings
    See ADJUSTABLE_SETTINGS in lbrynet/conf.py for full list of settings

name: settings_set
description: Set daemon settings
returns: (dict) Updated dictionary of daemon settings

name: status
description: Get daemon status

name: stop
description: Stop lbrynet API server.
returns: (string) Shutdown message

name: stream_abandon
description: Abandon one of my stream claims.

arguments.name: claim_id
arguments.description: claim_id of the claim to abandon

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: txid of the claim to abandon

arguments.name: nout
arguments.description: nout of the claim to abandon

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to use

arguments.name: preview
arguments.description: do not broadcast the transaction

arguments.name: blocking
arguments.description: wait until abandon is in mempool

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

name: stream_cost_estimate
description: Get estimated cost for a lbry stream

arguments.name: uri
arguments.description: uri to use

returns:
(float) Estimated cost in lbry credits, returns None if uri is not
        resolvable

name: stream_create
description: Make a new stream claim and announce the associated file to lbrynet.

arguments.name: name
arguments.description: name of the content (can only consist of a-z A-Z 0-9 and -(dash))

arguments.name: allow_duplicate_name
arguments.description: create new claim even if one already exists with given name. default: false.

arguments.name: bid
arguments.description: amount to back the claim

arguments.name: file_path
arguments.description: path to file to be associated with name.

arguments.name: stream_type
arguments.description: type of stream

arguments.name: fee_currency
arguments.description: specify fee currency

arguments.name: fee_amount
arguments.description: content download fee

arguments.name: fee_address
arguments.description: address where to send fee payments, will use value from --claim_address if not provided

arguments.name: title
arguments.description: title of the publication

arguments.name: description
arguments.description: description of the publication

arguments.name: author
arguments.description: author of the publication. The usage for this field is not the same as for channels. The author field is used to credit an author who is not the publisher and is not represented by the channel. For example, a pdf file of 'The Odyssey' has an author of 'Homer' but may by published to a channel such as '@classics', or to no channel at all

arguments.name: tags
arguments.description: add content tags

arguments.name: languages
arguments.description: languages used by the channel, using RFC 5646 format, eg: for English `--languages=en` for Spanish (Spain) `--languages=es-ES` for Spanish (Mexican) `--languages=es-MX` for Chinese (Simplified) `--languages=zh-Hans` for Chinese (Traditional) `--languages=zh-Hant`

arguments.name: locations
arguments.description: locations relevant to the stream, consisting of 2 letter `country` code and a `state`, `city` and a postal `code` along with a `latitude` and `longitude`. for JSON RPC: pass a dictionary with aforementioned attributes as keys, eg: ... "locations": [{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}] ... for command line: pass a colon delimited list with values in the following order: "COUNTRY:STATE:CITY:CODE:LATITUDE:LONGITUDE" making sure to include colon for blank values, for example to provide only the city: ... --locations="::Manchester" with all values set: ... --locations="US:NH:Manchester:03101:42.990605:-71.460989" optionally, you can just pass the "LATITUDE:LONGITUDE": ... --locations="42.990605:-71.460989" finally, you can also pass JSON string of dictionary on the command line as you would via JSON RPC ... --locations="{'country': 'US', 'state': 'NH'}"

                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",

                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",

examples.title: Update a stream claim to add channel.
examples.curl: curl -d'{"method": "stream_update", "params": {"claim_id": "23d67f3b1fdb3c7eb1649db09f02165a2be5440f", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "channel_id": "4a16eea8f2d6bfbd5d4d6740f3bf1b117d6924ca", "clear_channel": false, "channel_account_id": [], "preview": false}}' http://localhost:5279/
examples.python: requests.post("http://localhost:5279", json={"method": "stream_update", "params": {"claim_id": "23d67f3b1fdb3c7eb1649db09f02165a2be5440f", "tags": [], "clear_tags": false, "languages": [], "clear_languages": false, "locations": [], "clear_locations": false, "channel_id": "4a16eea8f2d6bfbd5d4d6740f3bf1b117d6924ca", "clear_channel": false, "channel_account_id": [], "preview": false}}).json()

                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"

arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

name: sync_apply
description:
Apply incoming synchronization data, if provided, and then produce a sync hash and
an encrypted wallet.

arguments.name: password
arguments.description: password to decrypt incoming and encrypt outgoing data

arguments.name: data
arguments.description: incoming sync data, if any

arguments.name: encrypt-password
arguments.description: password to encrypt outgoing data if different from the decrypt password, used during password changes

returns: (map) sync hash and data

name: sync_hash
description: Deterministic hash of the wallet.
returns: (str) sha256 hash of wallet

name: transaction_list
description: List transactions belonging to wallet

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to query

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

returns:
(list) List of transactions

    {
        "claim_info": (list) claim info if in txn [{
                                                "address": (str) address of claim,
                                                "balance_delta": (float) bid amount,
                                                "amount": (float) claim amount,
                                                "claim_id": (str) claim id,
                                                "claim_name": (str) claim name,
                                                "nout": (int) nout
                                                }],
        "abandon_info": (list) abandon info if in txn [{
                                                "address": (str) address of abandoned claim,
                                                "balance_delta": (float) returned amount,
                                                "amount": (float) claim amount,
                                                "claim_id": (str) claim id,
                                                "claim_name": (str) claim name,
                                                "nout": (int) nout
                                                }],
        "confirmations": (int) number of confirmations for the txn,
        "date": (str) date and time of txn,
        "fee": (float) txn fee,
        "support_info": (list) support info if in txn [{
                                                "address": (str) address of support,
                                                "balance_delta": (float) support amount,
                                                "amount": (float) support amount,
                                                "claim_id": (str) claim id,
                                                "claim_name": (str) claim name,
                                                "is_tip": (bool),
                                                "nout": (int) nout
                                                }],
        "timestamp": (int) timestamp,
        "txid": (str) txn id,
        "update_info": (list) update info if in txn [{
                                                "address": (str) address of claim,
                                                "balance_delta": (float) credited/debited
                                                "amount": (float) absolute amount,
                                                "claim_id": (str) claim id,
                                                "claim_name": (str) claim name,
                                                "nout": (int) nout
                                                }],
        "value": (float) value of txn
    }

name: transaction_show
description: Get a decoded transaction from a txid

arguments.name: txid
arguments.description: txid of the transaction

returns:
{
                "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                "inputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "outputs": [
                    {
                        "txid": "hash of transaction in hex",
                        "height": "block where transaction was recorded",
                        "nout": "position in the transaction",
                        "amount": "value of the txo as a decimal",
                        "address": "address of who can spend the txo",
                        "confirmations": "number of confirmed blocks"
                    }
                ],
                "total_input": "sum of inputs as a decimal",
                "total_output": "sum of outputs, sans fee, as a decimal",
                "total_fee": "fee amount",
                "hex": "entire transaction encoded in hex"
            }

name: utxo_list
description: List unspent transaction outputs

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to query

arguments.name: page
arguments.description: page to return during paginating

arguments.name: page_size
arguments.description: number of items on page during pagination

name: utxo_release
description:
When spending a UTXO it is locally locked to prevent double spends;
occasionally this can result in a UTXO being locked which ultimately
did not get spent (failed to broadcast, spend transaction was not
accepted by blockchain node, etc). This command releases the lock
on all UTXOs in your account.

arguments.name: account_id
arguments.description: id of the account to query

returns: None

name: version
description: Get lbrynet API server version information
returns:
(dict) Dictionary of lbry version information
    {
        'build': (str) build type (e.g. "dev", "rc", "release"),
        'ip': (str) remote ip, if available,
        'lbrynet_version': (str) lbrynet_version,
        'lbryum_version': (str) lbryum_version,
        'lbryschema_version': (str) lbryschema_version,
        'os_release': (str) os release string
        'os_system': (str) os name
        'platform': (str) platform string
        'processor': (str) processor type,
        'python_version': (str) python version,
    }
